sen.j: 弘文天皇元年（672年）の壬申の乱の際、背中に矢を受けた大海人皇子がこの地にかま風呂を作り傷を癒したことから「矢背」または「癒背」と呼ばれ、転じて「八瀬」となったという。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, Prince Oama, who had got an arrow in his back, built a steam bath there to heal his wound; the place was called "Yase 矢背," in which "ya" means "an arrow" and "se" means "the back," or "癒背" (healing the back), and then became known as "Yase 八瀬."
